required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Systems Biology Approach to Immune Monitoring in Patients With Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer Receiving SiPuleucel-T

lead_sponsor.agency: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

clinical_study.source: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this protocol is perform comprehensive immune monitoring studies in patients with castration-resistant prostate cancer receiving Sipuleucel-T in an effort to better understand the mechanism of action of this treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objectives of this study are to:
1. Establish the phenotype and frequency of circulating immune cell compartments in patients undergoing treatment with Sipuleucel-T.
2. Determine the induction and the quality of prostate antigen-specific T cell immunity in patients undergoing treatment with Sipuleucel-T.
3. Correlate whole-blood RNA transcript-based signatures with clinical outcomes in patients treated with Sipuleucel-T.
4. Evaluate the cytokine and chemokine milieu in the peripheral blood pre- and post-treatment with Sipuleucel-T.

primary_outcome.description: Establish the phenotype and frequency of circulating immune cell compartments in patients undergoing treatment with Sipuleucel-T looking at the change in regulatory T cells at 1 year post treatment compared to at baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Establish the phenotype and frequency of circulating immune cell compartments in patients undergoing treatment with Sipuleucel-T looking at the change in antigen presenting cells: DCs and B cells at 1 year post treatment compared to at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Prostate Antigen-specific T Cell Immunity

secondary_outcome.description: whole-blood RNA transcript-based signatures correlate with overall survival
whole-blood RNA transcript-based signatures correlate with overall survival

arm_group.description: Castration Resistant Metastatic Prostate Cancer with no history of prior systemic chemotherapy

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be recruited from those patients who receive their care at Mount Sinai Medical Center, or a participating site

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years of age
- Written informed consent obtained
- Patients with castration-resistant prostate cancer who are initiating Sipuleucel-T as standard therapy
- No prior systemic chemotherapy for metastatic prostate cancer
- Hemoglobin > 9 mg/dl
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unable to understand the research protocol and/or provide informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

facility.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
